column4: hey guys... apparenlty apple movie trailers is not working...ubuntu cannot find required plugin to play...did apple get upset with linux  because of cairo dock and the such ? :)
but you can play other quicktime files?
mm I havent tried but all other streaming video work  and I have tried this on two installs here with the same errors  so it isnt on this end
and you are sure that you have support for the quicktime stuff?
I would check if you can play any other quicktime movies
yeah  I do ...and I am playing a quicktime move now
but it doesnt work on the apple movie trailer site
check if .mov is listed in the about:plugins
it sure is  version 7.2.0
these movies play fine  http://www.spacetoday.org/STOmovies.html
is it telling you something like text/html decoder not installed?
yes it is
is there a solution to this?
I am still looking
I came over this error myself now
cool... I have googled allnight :)
this is a rather fun error
since all other quiktime stuff works
apprently apple is peeved   http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1245441&page=3
however it seems that totem does not understand the text/html from the site...which is making me a bit confused...this would probably work with mplayer
no it wont work with mplayer either...this is apple  changing the site requirement so that others cannot access the trailers
common problem then
I have no idea then....
no problem
